comment.body: I think the content can be editted everytime, but if there is no one who can be informed about new changes, changes will remain only on editor's computer. I do not know if/how frequently zeronet will try to find another peers automaticaly - so changes can be propagated to others. (anyone know?)
@Hubi: i just found 3 peers
@Hubi: make sure to use good tracker file like data/1JuwWYEgApiBVNyGxhvNYyohsv4YMtxy7M/trackers_all.txt on [/Config](/Config) page
i think reason is not enough peers who have the content.json...

@Hubi Maybe it can take some time until there are such peer/s on the trackers you are using or you may try to add all trackers from https://github.com/ngosang/trackerslist/blob/master/trackers_all.txt to your /Config to increase the chances of finding peers even more. I am just guessing.
@Hubi: i think (may be wrong) that when you open new site, you can see there are peers, the peer count grows, but you still see it fails to DL the content.json
i think it means that peeple like oyu trying to open the site, but initial peer/seeder is offline so no one has the content.json
in this case i think no tracker given you (for various reasons) a peer who have content.json

i think zeronet page is showing a peer even it do not have content.json to share with you, peer does not necesarily mean full completed file. It can mean partial file like in torrents.. and in this case they probably do not have most important file - content.json
:-) important to connect to many trackers, especialy default ones, i think it increase your chance to find peer who has the content.json so you can DL it & distribute to other peers.

@Hubi: it is a zerome hub it is zeronet site. When you [open it](/1GrEenUGRWnzaNZjR3XsQa6dQgdPDTyt7i) and then drag & drop the (0) button to the left, you see: GreenHub.
zerome hubs - sites like that store information about users posts and also store users uploaded images.
@Hubi: thx
i thought ZN is using bittorrent as one of its components, so it can not be its replacement
i think she recorded three episodes, i am missing her on ZeroNet but hoping she is more happy without it

> @blurHY: "we have to teach user how to bypass the GFW through meek (like tor) bridge or free proxies."
i thought there already is this. When user is loading a zite it fails and shows some kind of message reagarding tor meek bridges. If you have some really good idea on improvement which you can do, ask nofish on github maybe.

i can not imagine how images can be needed on that site. ZeroSites is just an index where you need to have as much information per the page as possible, not to see page bloated with images.. Also unsure how comments can help. Tags and filtering definately yes (if community can help tweak the tags, because user can enter non related tags).
would better like smaller font and round corners of the font, smaller circle when comparing to font
sounds nice Blurhy
@leftside: i see blank page at /12q9YNb5oJ331nTjUxWefV9W2EXpMu8RWi
try to post your site urls on zerotalk topic about 0net.io

specific topic, search site address in ZeroHello newsfeed, like this: siteaddresshere site:zerotalk

0net.io is also on the clearnet, on github, you can submit the issue maybe

it should work to run Tor for Zeronet, if not, you can describe the errors and what you did.

why do you think your tor is running at port 9151 and 9150? I would try to run the zeronet.sh without that tor related p@r@meters and also with ports 9050 and 9051 instead. In my tor browser proxy settings i see 9150 and i am on Windows, on Linux i remember i had port 90xx not 91xx . Btw. [there](/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/faq/#how-to-make-zeronet-work-with-tor-under-linuxmacos) are some tips for zeronet with tor on Linux.

also check this topic of mine: [How to Install and run Zeronet on any Linux server like Raspberry Pi (zeronet seedbox, public proxy)](/16Go5kc2U9Ff4jeaY8kYiDEgpMYdgyboPY/?Topic:2_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+Install+and+run+Zeronet+on+a+Raspberry+Pi+or+any+Linux+computer)

**[Blog post translation into english here](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=zh-CN&tl=en&u=https%3A%2F%2Fblurhy.xyz%2F2019%2F06%2F30%2FÁªüËÆ°‰∏éÂàÜÊûêHorizonÁà¨Ëô´Êï∞ÊçÆ%2F&sandbox=1)** (Google translate). [this image](https://blurhy.xyz/images/h2.png) seems to show rough number of zeronet sites that was created during last years! interesting, offcourse blurhy's spider likely not catched all sites, some was not announced..

@blurhy: search engine would be nice (only if it is decentralized and can survive at possible future zeronet conditions), atm ZeroHello search is too slow (hundreds of sites and no SSD) that i have to only search selectively on zerotalk and zerome, else zeronet lags (single threading) for minutes. I am not sure if it is not too much work to create useful decentralized fulltext search for the Zeronet, but if it can be done to be returning search results quickly, then maybe create some simple front-end site where it return raw results, which user can filter entering must include, must exclude words to quickly narrow results, + - operators and full phrases wrapped by quotation marks. SE maybe not need to be that much clever if it is too much work.
= Regarding IPFS, maybe IPFS is more useful thing to work on than the search engine (do not know), but if IPFS will help chinese users to use zeronet, then certainly is more priority than the search engine.
if the two networks (zeronet and **zeronet+ipfs**) peers will be unable to connect, it would be good if there is a plugin that makes the connection possible - if that is possible and a good idea.

D‚Ç¨centralized Zeronet identity authority (zeroid.bit alternative) that only humans (not bots) can register?
[kxoid](/1GTVetvjTEriCMzKzWSP9FahYoMPy6BG1P/?/kxoid) decentralization does not seem to me ideal/reliable (see paragraph "Federated system")

@blurHY: on the internet is problem with domain names. Domain gets seized by the government or accidentaly lost and all the links people added accross the internet stop working - a big problem. [Same with .bit domains here](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1516098717_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/Does+bit+mean+a+single+point+of+failure).

@blurHY: but who financing the namecoin domain releval? One deadly person? Or there are mechanisms so the site visitors are financing renewals automaticaly or other way without need of some peron/s be dedicated to it?

Interesting article. I was wondering about the progress creating decentralized zeronet search engine. For the time being we would have to rely on ZeroHello search and site searches like [one Kaffie introduced today](/1FEH3VjjKoDTXSpUA1G4xpB7WFnfQ48oVC)
i am not using that Telegram service
Looks quite good, i like it is single color.. though it has no Z letter in it, only similar color to one used by zeronet
looks significantly better than previous one

This is really exciting! This seems like a very important reading for those who are interested in developing such a project. Maybe worth linking it from [your repository](https://gitlab.com/ipzn/ipzn/) readme or via https://gitlab.com/ipzn/ipzn/wikis/home (which looks empty for me).
I think that the top priorities of IPZN should be:
- unable to break by the government
- scallable fast for large sites with alot of users
- anonymity and secure transfer of the data (tor or i2p?)
- protection from spam, ddos

as Robert says. Zerome and its [cloned sites](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1534264686_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS) are an interface to view content of other sites (zerome hubs) which store actual posts, comments and images. Each user is part of some hub. related topic: "[How Does ZeroMe be able to reach hubs you didnt seed](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1524573807_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K#comment_787_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS)"

Communism to me feels just one of numerous ways the society "wants" to be managed. Communism failed in western countries (in some very miserably), that is why in these countries it sometimes target of bad publicity.

Personaly i think communism, autocracy is worse than democracy, because it gather too much power in the hands of leaders (who are inperfect people) and it is known that too much power in too low amount of people is not "healthy". In democracy there is some accountability because there is free press and free society. Politics know people will judge them and vote for others if they do bad or eventualy protest/rise to protect their freedoms. I do not like regimes that dictate one opinion and punish people for what they believe/Christians or just any people that point out about failures of the governing class.
@blurHY: how exactly it prevents progress and where that progress should be in your opinion?

@blurHY: well you were generalizing regarding prevention of the progress and it is not good. SOME religions only refuse research in small areas like "opposition to research into embryonic stem cells", and because of that saying something like "religion prevents world progress" is very unfair. Most countries leaders do not care about what some religious leaders want, religion can hardly prevent progress and it can be actualy beneficial (when people behave like it is taught in the Bible).
@blurHY: You are inconsisent. You said "it prevents", now you mean "prevented"? Ok, then i agree with that, but better to talk about current and future state of things.

@blurHY: "distracts and wastes people's effort". It depends on each person goals. People add importance to various different things. Some to have influence and wealth, some to be educated, some to be a better person like Jesus Christ was. Each thing has its positive impact. I do not think it is a waste of my effort and time to be religious wanting to be better person according to Bible. Wrong, i think the religious people are not against scientific advantages and such. Being satisfied with what you have is important for your happiness and does not mean one resign on improving things further.

@blurHY: reasonable satisfaction about one's life does not necessarily mean resigning on improving things in a society. Actualy christians can not be satisfied with current society, as they understand the root causes of the current state and that is is a temporary state.

@blurHY: wrong. I think you put your own words into my mouth. I do not think i have said something like that i believe religious people are satisfied, it is you who started with that - You started talking something about satisfaction of the religious people (i think meant the satisfaction with current state of things) which i answered. Regarding "better life" i was rather speaking about the world human society as a whole not about individual life where i think it is obvious that we have to care about our life and no prayer will cause the God to make a miracle for any believer.

@blurHY: from my experience no, i do not agree on that ) i do not think prayers will add some reward to anyone. It is similar like when you talk to your friend. It is a wire-less way to communicate. People (including me) have seen effects of the prayer in their life. I am not talking about miracles here, rather about feelings of extraordinary support or the help to be brave end endure tough things. Prayer can help develop relationship and it also keep you on the way on becoming better person.

@blurHY: appreciation and love is not stupid, even more when it is highly deserved. But it is very understandable that for Godless people the prayer seems foolish ) 
Maybe people are not interested or maybe also not enough humble or has not enough love, not enough kind heart to find out. It is not only about information, but also about "heart".
@blurHY: i can not react on your "argument" as i do not know what do you mean by the "with religious shit".
@Dilans: i would rather like to live in present USA than in present communist North Korea.

@blurHY: indeed, it appears it was for years though: "[North Korea replaced Communism with the Juche ideology in its 1992 and 1998 constitutional revisions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communism_in_Korea)".
